title: [ER] Better error message for goto statements

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Some Rust code is translated from C, so I think Rustc could recognize gotos and give a better error message:

```rust
fn main() {
    'FOO:
    goto 'FOO;
}
```

Currently rustc 1.59.0 (nightly 2021-12-21) gives:

```
error: expected `while`, `for`, `loop` or `{` after a label
 --> ...\test.rs:3:5
  |
3 |     goto 'FOO;
  |     ^^^^ expected `while`, `for`, `loop` or `{` after a label

error: expected one of `!`, `.`, `::`, `;`, `?`, `{`, `}`, or an operator, found `'FOO`
 --> ...\test.rs:3:10
  |
3 |     goto 'FOO;
  |          ^^^^ expected one of 8 possible tokens
```

A better error message could explain that Rust doesn't have gotos, and that labeled breaks of outer loops (that's missing in C), returns and match{} could sometimes replace the goto well enough.
